abstract: The type of collision bounds associated with the item.
overview:
## Discussion

The dynamics system uses this property to determine how to evaluate collisions with the dynamic item. Rectangular and elliptical bounds are defined by the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/bounds] property of the item. For custom collision bounds, the shape of the bounds are in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/collisionBoundingPath] property.

If you implement this property in your dynamic item and set its value to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType/path], you must also implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/collisionBoundingPath] property and provide a valid path. Failure to do so is a programmer error.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType/rectangle].

# collisionBoundsType

**Instance Property**

The type of collision bounds associated with the item.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional var collisionBoundsType: UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType { get }
```

## Discussion

The dynamics system uses this property to determine how to evaluate collisions with the dynamic item. Rectangular and elliptical bounds are defined by the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/bounds] property of the item. For custom collision bounds, the shape of the bounds are in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/collisionBoundingPath] property.

If you implement this property in your dynamic item and set its value to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType/path], you must also implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem/collisionBoundingPath] property and provide a valid path. Failure to do so is a programmer error.

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType/rectangle].

## Participating in dynamic animation

- **bounds**: Called when a dynamic animator needs the bounds of the dynamic item.
- **center**: The center point of the dynamic item.
- **transform**: The rotation of the dynamic item.
- **collisionBoundingPath**: The path-based shape to use for the collision bounds.
